Buckinghamshire is a non-metropolitan county in the ceremonial county of Buckinghamshire, England. It covers about four-fifths of area of the ceremonial county and about two-thirds of its population; the City of Milton Keynes accounts for the remainder.  The district is administered by Buckinghamshire Council, a unitary authority.
]]
History
The non-metropolitan county became a unitary authority area on 1 April 2020, following the merger of four boroughs and districts Aylesbury Vale, Chiltern, South Bucks and Wycombe as part of the 2019â€“2023 structural changes to local government in England.
Main settlements
* Amersham
* Aylesbury
* Beaconsfield
* Buckingham
* Burnham
* Chesham
* High Wycombe
* Marlow
